Ah, Paris! What a sight it was! I arrived in Paris on my humble yellow horse, a bit battered from the journey, but my heart was full of hope. The city was a marvel, a labyrinth of bustling streets and grand buildings, with steeples that seemed to pierce the heavens. It was a world away from my quiet Gascony. Within my first day, I found myself in more scrapes than I had in my entire life before! I managed to arrange duels with three of the King's finest Musketeers, all for separate, and I admit, rather foolish reasons. But it was this very chaos that led me to my dearest friends: the noble Athos, the jovial Porthos, and the gentle Aramis. Paris, for all its dangers and intrigues, was where my true life began. "I came to Paris with four crowns in my pocket, and I would have fought with anybody who dared to tell me I was not in a condition to purchase the Louvre." That was the spirit that carried me then, and it carries me still!
